xal.extension.twissobserver

Class CourantSnyderEstimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • xal.extension.twissobserver.CourantSnyderEstimator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CsContinuationEstimator, CsFixedPtEstimator, CsZeroCurrentEstimator

    public abstract class CourantSnyderEstimator
extends java.lang.Object

    Base class for the problem of reconstructing Courant-Snyder parameters from beam profile data at multiple locations along a beamline. This class provide common tools and attributes that child classes can share, as well as the ability to compute the zero-current solution.

    Subclasses compute the covariance matrix σ from the given data at the given device location. This is the set of second-order moments of the beam distribution. Since the measurement data cannot show coupling between phase planes, the covariance matrix is block diagonal where the 2×2 blocks correspond to each independent phase plane (see CovarianceMatrix). If the measurement data is zero for any phase plane, then the diagonal block corresponding to that phase plane is also zero.

    The second-order moments are computed from and observation matrix which, in the zero current case, is independent of the initial state of the beam. The observation matrix relates the initial state (described by the second moments) to the observed quantities, in this case the measurement data of RMS beam sizes. For each phase plane: In the case were there are more data points than there are variables (i.e., greater than 3) then the returned solution is the least-squares solution; specifically, the set of moments that hits the most data. In the case where there are less data points than variables (i.e., less than 3) then the returned solution is the minimum norm (or "least energy") solution; specifically, the solution that has the smallest Lebesgue 2-norm. If we have 3 data points for the phase plane then the unique solution is returned.

    Since:
    Apr 12, 2013

      • CourantSnyderEstimator

        public CourantSnyderEstimator(boolean bolDebug,
                              TransferMatrixGenerator genTransMat)

        Creates a new TwissObserverBase object using the given maximum iteration count, maximum convergence error, and the given transfer matrix generator. This constructor must be used if Twiss parameters are to be computed in the presence of space charge (see #computeCovarianceFiniteCurrent(String, double, ArrayList)).

        Parameters:
        cntMaxIter - maximum number of allowed search iterations
        dblMaxError - maximum L2 convergence error in the solution
        genTransMat - a pre-configured transfer matrix engine used internally.
        Since:
        Jul 20, 2012

    • Method Detail

      • computeReconstruction

        public abstract CovarianceMatrix computeReconstruction(java.lang.String strRecDevId,
                                                       double dblBnchFreq,
                                                       double dblBmCurr,
                                                       java.util.ArrayList<Measurement> arrData)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception

        Computes the covariance matrix at the given location which is most likely to produce the given data. That is, the covariance matrix is constructed at the given device location from the data provided and for the given beam current.

        Parameters:
        strRecDevId - ID of the device where the reconstruction is to be performed
        dblBnchFreq - bunch arrival frequency (in Hz)
        dblBmCurr - beam current (in Amperes)
        arrData - the profile measurement data used for the reconstruction
        Returns:
        block diagonal covariance matrix containing the second-order moments of the beam at the reconstruction location
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - general error occurred during the reconstruction computations
        Since:
        Apr 2, 2013

      • setDebug

        public void setDebug(boolean bolDebug)
        Turn debugging output on or off. The default case is off.
        Parameters:
        bolDebug - true to enable debugging output or false to turn it off
        Since:
        Nov 16, 2012

      • isDebuggingOn

        public boolean isDebuggingOn()
        Returns the value of the debugging flag.
        Returns:
        true if the class is in the debugging state, false no debugging information is being generated
        Since:
        Apr 16, 2013

      • getReconstruction

        public CovarianceMatrix getReconstruction()

        Returns the current solution covariance matrix. This matrix is useful if an iterative solution algorithm was used (e.g., for the finite space charge) and it did not converge. The returned value is then the last value of the solution before the algorithm was terminated.

        NOTE:

        · It is the responsibility of the subclass to keep this value up to date.

        Returns:
        covariance matrix being the last computed solution value in an iterative algorithm
        Since:
        Nov 21, 2012

      • getReconResidualError

        public double getReconResidualError()

        Returns the residual error of the last solution, i.e., the solution returned by getReconstruction(). The numerical value is the Frobenius norm of the solution residual matrix.

        NOTE:

        · It is the responsibility of the subclass to keep this value up to date.

        Returns:
        ||Ωσ* - X||F   where σ* is the solution
        Since:
        Nov 21, 2012

      • getReconConvergenceError

        public double getReconConvergenceError()

        Returns the convergence error for the last solution iteration, i.e., the distance between the solution returned by getReconstruction() and the solution previous. The numerical value is the Frobenius norm of the distance between iterates.

        NOTE:

        · It is the responsibility of the subclass to keep this value up to date.

        Returns:
        || σi+1 - σi ||F   where σ* is the solution
        Since:
        Nov 21, 2012

      • computeZeroCurrReconFunction

        public CovarianceMatrix computeZeroCurrReconFunction(java.lang.String strRecDevId,
                                                     java.util.ArrayList<Measurement> arrData)
                                              throws ModelException
        Returns the recursion function for a zero-current beam at the given device location and for the given profile measurement data. This method actually returns the results of #computeReconFunction(CovarianceMatrix, double, String, ArrayList) for zero current and undefined initial beam moments.
        Parameters:
        strRecDevId - device ID where the Courant-Snyder parameters are being reconstructed
        arrData - profile measurement data along beamline
        Returns:
        covariance matrix containing the value of the recursion function generated from matSig0 and dblChrg
        Throws:
        ModelException - a general error occurred while computing the transfer matricies
        Since:
        Apr 18, 2013

      • computeReconFunction

        public CovarianceMatrix computeReconFunction(CovarianceMatrix matSig0,
                                             double dblBnchFreq,
                                             double dblBeamCurr,
                                             java.lang.String strRecDevId,
                                             java.util.ArrayList<Measurement> arrData)
                                      throws ModelException
        Returns the recursion function for a finite current beam with the given beam charge for the given beam state at the sequence start. This method actually returns the results of computeReconSubFunction(PHASEPLANE, String, ArrayList) simultaneously for all three phase planes as a covariance matrix. In this method, the transfer matrices are explicitly computed for the given initial covariance matrix and the given beam current. The returned matrix is block diagonal (and symmetric) containing the moments in the usual locations.
        Parameters:
        matSig0 - beam covariance matrix at the accelerator sequence start
        dblChrg - beam charge
        strRecDevId - device ID where the Courant-Snyder parameters are being reconstructed
        arrData - profile measurement data along beamline
        Returns:
        covariance matrix containing the value of the recursion function generated from matSig0 and dblChrg
        Throws:
        ModelException - a general error occurred while computing the transfer matricies
        Since:
        Apr 18, 2013

      • computeObservationMatrix

        public Jama.Matrix computeObservationMatrix(java.lang.String strReconDevId,
                                            java.util.ArrayList<Measurement> arrData)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Compute the observation matrix which yields the vector of beam moments at the given beamline element from the set of beam size measurements provided in the argument. The matrix is returned as a eMatrix object so that matrices for all three phase planes may be returned. Currently coupling between phase planes is not consided. Thus, the returned matrix is block-diagonal having three 3n×9 matrices on the diagonal (where n is the number of data locations), one for each phase plane, horizontal, vertical, diagonal, respectively.

        NOTES:

        · The transfer matrix generator object is accessed to retrieve whatever transfer matrices it contains when this method is called. BE CAREFUL to generate the appropriate transfer matrices before this method is called.

        Parameters:
        strReconDevId - String id of reconstruction element
        arrData - list of beam size measurement data
        Returns:
        a PhaseMatrix containing the observation matrices for all 3 phase planes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - unknown phase plane or unknown device
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - transfer matrices have not been generated
        Since:
        Apr 16, 2013

      • computeReconSubFunction

        protected Jama.Matrix computeReconSubFunction(PHASEPLANE plane,
                                              java.lang.String strTargElemId,
                                              java.util.ArrayList<Measurement> arrData)

        Computes the σ vector from the observer matrix and the given data for the given phase plane. This is the vector of second-order moments of the beam distribution. The returned value is a 3×1 matrix of real numbers having the form

            σ = ( <x2>, <xx'>, <x'2> )T

        where the moments are taken from the horizontal plane. The vertical plane computation returns an analogous set. The three phase planes are treated independently and solutions for each plane returned separately.

        In the case were there are more data points than there are variables (i.e., greater than 3) then the returned solution is the least-squares solution; specifically, the set of moments that hits the most data. In the case where there are less data points than variables (i.e., less than 3) then the returned solution is the minimum norm (or "least energy") solution; specifically, the solution that has the smallest Lebesgue 2-norm. If we have three data points then the unique solution is returned.

        NOTES:

        · IMPORTANT: The moments are computed using the transfer matrices currently stored in the internal transfer matrix generator object. Thus, whatever generation was used prior to this call is used to compute the recursion sub-function.
        · If the reconstruction device has non-zero length the location of the moments corresponds to the exit of the device.

        Parameters:
        arrData - Array List of Location Data
        plane - Phase plane for which to compute the observer matrix
        strTargElemId - reconstruction location
        Returns:
        Resulting σ vector of second moments at the given device location

      • computeObservationMatrix

        protected Jama.Matrix computeObservationMatrix(PHASEPLANE plane,
                                               java.lang.String strReconDevId,
                                               java.util.ArrayList<Measurement> arrData)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                               java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Computes the observation matrix from the given data and accelerator node ID of the reconstruction location.

        NOTES:

        · The transfer matrix generator object is accessed to retrieve whatever transfer matrices it contains when this method is called. BE CAREFUL to generate the appropriate transfer matrices before this method is called.

        Parameters:
        plane - Phase plane to calculate to consider
        strReconDevId - String id of reconstruction element
        arrData - list of beam size data
        Returns:
        Observation matrix for the given data and target location
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - unknown phase plane or unknown device
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - transfer matrices have not been generated
        See Also:
        TransferMatrixGenerator.generateWithoutSpaceCharge(), TransferMatrixGenerator#generateWithSpaceCharge(String, double, CovarianceMatrix)

      • computeResidualError

        protected double computeResidualError(CovarianceMatrix matSigSoln,
                                      java.lang.String strRecDevId,
                                      java.util.ArrayList<Measurement> arrData)
        Computes and returns the Lebesgue 2-norm of the error residual for the given solution and problem data.
        Parameters:
        matSigSoln - solution matrix of second-order moments
        strRecDevId - device ID where the reconstruction is performed (location of solution)
        arrData - array of problem data
        Returns:
        ||X - Ωσ||2
        Since:
        Nov 15, 2012

      • computeConvergenceError

        protected double computeConvergenceError(CovarianceMatrix matSig1,
                                         CovarianceMatrix matSig0)
        Computes the norm of the distance between the given covariance solution matrix and the last solution matrix. This method should be called under the assumption that an iterative solution technique is being employed and we are monitoring a Cauchy sequence to check for convergence.
        Parameters:
        matSig1 - current solution iterate σi+1
        matSig0 - previous solution iterate σi
        Returns:
        the (Frobenius) distance between the current iterate and the previous one || σi+1 - σi ||F
        Since:
        Apr 5, 2013
